activities: INC Research, LLC and INC Research Holdings, Inc.  (collectively, “INC Research”) provide services that include those that are related to clinical trials of all phases as well as post-marketing pharmacovigilance and surveillance activities (collectively, the “Services”).  In connection with the Services, INC Research may collect and process certain personal data received from the EEA and Switzerland pertaining to clinical research participants; study investigators and their staff; medical and healthcare professionals; pharmaceutical industry experts and opinion leaders; customers such as pharmaceutical, medical device and biotechnology companies; vendors; contractors; consultants; and consumers.  In addition, INC Research may process human resources data from current, former, and potential (1) officers, directors, employees, contractor labors or temporary employees (collectively, “Associates”), (2) agents of INC Research, including any consultants or representatives, (3) beneficiaries identified by Associates, and (4) retirees  located in the EEA or Switzerland.  These data may be collected and transferred to INC Research, LLC in the U.S. in support of INC Research’s business activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources
recoursemech: For non-human resources data, INC Research will work with the relevant sponsor or other applicable data controller to address the complaint.  If a data subject’s complaint cannot be resolved through INC Research’s internal processes in cooperation with the relevant sponsor or other applicable data controller, INC Research will cooperate with JAMS.  For human resources data, INC Research will cooperate with the European Union Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC), as appropriate.
